draw out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to take money from your bank account
draw out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make someone feel less shy and more willing to talk
draw out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: She just needed someone to draw her out and take an interest in her.
draw out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to mention a particular piece of information and explain it clearly and in detail
draw out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: There are two major themes to be drawn out in this discussion.
draw out.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to make an event last longer than usual
draw out.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The final question drew the meeting out for another hour.
draw out.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if the days or nights draw out, it stays light until later in the evening because summer is coming
